org.itsnat.core.domutil

Interface ElementTree

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ElementGroup, ItsNatUserData

    public interface ElementTree
extends ElementGroup
    Represents a pattern based DOM tree with a removable root. This structure may be seen as a tree node list with none or only one tree node.

    The starting point is a root DOM tree node, this node is saved as the pattern (really a deep clone). This pattern is used to recreate the root node (the root may be removed).

    The initial root tree node may be initially removed or kept as is when this tree is created and attached to the underlying DOM.

    Author:
    Jose Maria Arranz Santamaria
    See Also:
    ElementGroupManager.createElementTree(boolean,Element,boolean,ElementTreeNodeStructure,ElementTreeNodeRenderer)

        Informs whether the current tree has a root tree node (not empty).
        Returns:
        true if the tree has a root tree node.

      • getRootNode

        ElementTreeNode getRootNode()
        Returns the root tree node.
        Returns:
        the root tree node or null if the tree is empty.
        See Also:
        addRootNode(), removeRootNode()

      • addRootNode

        ElementTreeNode addRootNode()
        Adds a root tree node. If the tree already has a root node an exception is thrown.

        The new tree node uses the current structure and renderer of the tree.

        Returns:
        the new root node.
        See Also:
        getRootNode(), removeRootNode()

      • addRootNode

        ElementTreeNode addRootNode(java.lang.Object value)
        Adds a root tree node and renders the value using the current structure and renderer. If the tree already has a root node an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        the new root node.
        See Also:
        addRootNode(), getElementTreeNodeStructure(), getElementTreeNodeRenderer()

      • removeRootNode

        void removeRootNode()
        Removes the current root tree node. If the tree has no root does nothing.
        See Also:
        getRootNode(), addRootNode()

      • getElementTreeNodeFromRow

        ElementTreeNode getElementTreeNodeFromRow(int row)
        Returns the tree node at the specified row position seeing the tree as a list (root node is 0).
        Parameters:
        row - the row position.
        Returns:
        the tree node at the specified position or null if the tree is empty or row is out of bounds.

      • getElementTreeNodeFromNode

        ElementTreeNode getElementTreeNodeFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node)
        Returns the tree node containing the specified node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to search for.
        Returns:
        the tree node containing the specified node. Null if not contained by this tree.

      • isUsePatternMarkupToRender

        boolean isUsePatternMarkupToRender()
        Informs whether the original (saved as pattern) markup is used to render.

        The default value is defined by ItsNatDocument.isUsePatternMarkupToRender()

        Returns:
        true if the original markup is used.
        See Also:
        setUsePatternMarkupToRender(boolean)

      • setUsePatternMarkupToRender

        void setUsePatternMarkupToRender(boolean value)
        Sets whether the original (saved as pattern) markup is used to render.
        Parameters:
        value - true to enable the use of original markup to render.
        See Also:
        isUsePatternMarkupToRender()
